para.text: These regulations govern City water quality management areas under control of the City and administered by the Department of Public Works, including:
In this chapter, the following terms have the meanings indicated.
"Baltimore County" means the County Council and municipal government of Baltimore County, Maryland.
"Baltimore City reservoir" means a reservoir owned and operated by Baltimore City.
"Baltimore Environmental Police" means a sworn police officer appointed by the Director to protect persons and natural resources within a water quality management area.
"City" means the Mayor and City Council of Baltimore.
"Deer trail" means a trail that has been worn down by the passage of deer and other wildlife.
"Department" means the Baltimore City Department of Public Works.
"Director" means the Director of the Baltimore City Department of Public Works.
"Double bottom" means an additional layer of structure below the main bottom of a watercraft.

The area south of the Loch Raven Drive Bridge at Loch Raven Reservoir; and
An area within 1500 feet of the dam at Prettyboy Reservoir.
"Flotation material" means a substance made of composite materials designed to increase buoyancy in a watercraft.
"Geocaching" means to hide a small container or other item at discrete locations for the purpose of using GPS coordinates to locate the item.
"Hunt" means to pursue or attempt to pursue a bird or mammal to personal possession.

"DNR" means the Maryland Department of Natural Resources.
"Motorized vehicle" means a mode of transportation powered by an internal engine by which a person or property may be transported on a roadway.
A vehicle being towed by another motorized vehicle.
Fires nonlethal ammunition using compressed air; and
Is intended to incapacitate, but not kill, a target.
"Organized group activity" means an event that is:

"Paddle boat" means a watercraft that is propelled through the use of a paddle wheel.
"Pedal kayak" means a watercraft with a closed deck that is propelled by foot pedals that drive a propeller or fins.
"Permit holder" means a person who has obtained a permit to operate a watercraft at a water quality management area in accordance with this chapter from:
"Person" has the meaning stated in City Code General Provisions Article, § 1-107.
"Person" includes a governmental entity or an instrumentality or unit of a governmental entity.
"Personal flotation device" means a piece of equipment used to prevent drowning.

Storing hazardous materials in a manner that threatens the public water supply; or
Altering the water in a Baltimore City reservoir or tributary in a manner that could harm:
"Reservoir watershed" means the source water area for the Baltimore Metropolitan Supply as defined by the Baltimore Metropolitan Council.

"Right of entry agreement" means a contract between a person and the City of Baltimore which allows access during a prescribed period of time for a defined group of people to engage in specific activities within a WQMA.

Inhale vapors from or otherwise allow vapors to be emitted from an electronic smoking device.
"Verifiable" means possessing documentation which is recognized as valid by a state or local government as a means of establishing the identity of a person, organization, or other entity.
"Watercraft" means a vessel licensed by the State:
Designed for travel across or through a body of water; and
Powered by a means of propulsion in accordance with this chapter.
"Watercraft launch area" means a designated ramp for watercraft launch and recovery.
"Water quality management area" means a reservoir or adjoining land controlled or owned by the City of Baltimore
A leased property within a WQMA boundary;
A utility right-of-way within a WQMA boundary;
Infrastructure required to direct water from a reservoir to a water treatment facility.
"Watershed" has the meaning stated in City Code Article 7, § 21-1(aa).
"Woods road" means an unpaved road in a water quality management area built and maintained by the City.
In addition to the vessel specifications in regulation .05 of this chapter, a permit holder operating a watercraft in a WQMA shall ensure that the watercraft:
Is in compliance with applicable federal and State boating safety requirements;
Is buoyant if submerged through use of:
Marine plywood a minimum of ¼ inch thick;
A battery-powered electric motor in accordance with §B of this regulation.
One wearable personal flotation device for each person on board;
One throwable personal flotation device for watercraft longer than 16 feet;
A means of producing a sound such as a:
Closed compartments under seats or thwarts;
Are not sealed to the hull; or
Are not completely filled with flotation materials.
Permanently installed fuel tanks that contain a fire extinguisher.
A permit holder operating a watercraft with a battery-powered electric motor in a WQMA shall ensure the battery powered electric motor does not exceed a maximum output of 18kW.
The City may remove a watercraft from a WQMA whose occupants are found in violation of this chapter.

section.heading: Watercraft Specifications – Prohibitions.
section.text: A permit holder may not operate the following types of watercraft in a WQMA:

para.text: A watercraft with a gasoline-powered motor;
A watercraft with an electric motor that does not conform to the manufacturer's specification; or
A permit holder operating a boat in a WQMA shall ensure the boat has:
A beam width of no less than 48 inches; and
A depth of no less than 18 inches.
A permit holder operating a canoe in a WQMA shall ensure the canoe has:
A maximum length of 20 feet; and
A beam width of at least 35 inches.
A permit holder operating a kayak in a WQMA shall ensure the kayak has:
A minimum length of 12 feet; and
A permit holder may operate a pedal kayak in a WQMA.

no motor is used in the kayak; or

A minimum length of 12 feet; and

A person may not allow the grazing or free roaming of livestock at a WQMA.
Except in a posted area, a person in possession of a Maryland Freshwater Sportfishing License may fish within a WQMA if the person complies with the provisions of this regulation.
Fishing at a WQMA is permitted:

From watercrafts between March 1 and December 31 annually.
Fishing is permitted from the banks year-round.

section.heading: Recreational Activities – Right of Entry Agreement.

para.text: A person shall obtain a Right of Entry Agreement for an organized group activity in a WQMA.
A person may execute a Right of Entry Agreement for a group activity in a WQMA by emailing the Office of Legal and Regulatory Affairs, using the contact information found on the Department website.

section.heading: Recreational Activities - Additional Prohibitions.
section.text: A person in a WQMA may not:

para.text: Erect a structure, whether permanent or temporary;
Climb a tree, except as provided in regulation .10 of this chapter;
Skate or walk on frozen sections of the watershed;

section.heading: Wildlife.
section.text: A person may not feed the wildlife at a WQMA.

section.heading: Weapons.
section.text: A person may not possess a firearm in a WQMA, unless the person is:

para.text: Making lawful use of the Loch Raven Skeet and Trap Center; or
A sworn police officer, including a member of the Baltimore Environmental Police.

section.heading: Disorderly Conduct.
section.text: A person may not interfere with City personnel or a City contractor conducting operations in a WQMA.

section.text: A person may not light or maintain a fire in a WQMA, including:

Possess or consume an alcoholic beverage in a WQMA.
A person may not operate a motorized vehicle on an unpaved woods road, except:
A contractor working on behalf of the City of Baltimore.
A woods road entrance with a vehicle; or
A gate or public access with a vehicle.
Park in violation of a posted sign or where otherwise prohibited.
